trans:
1 egg
20 g butter at room temperature
10 g salt (1 teaspoon)
For the sauce:
1 head of garlic (It was hard to cook in the casserole, so wrap it first in baking paper, then in aluminum foil, and bake at 200Â°C for about 15 minutesâ€”make sure the oven is preheated. Let it cool completely until it's soft.)
Oregano, olive oil, salt (Pour the olive oil and seasonings over the garlic before putting it in the oven.)
70 g butter, parsley
100 g grated cheddar cheese
Let the butter come to room temperature. Mash the garlic, finely chop the parsley, and mix everything together. The sauce is ready. ğŸ˜Œ
Instructions
Place the flour in a mixing bowl, make a well in the center, add the yeast, sugar, and warm milk, and wait for the yeast to activate (about 5 minutes). Add all the necessary ingredients, excluding the butter (including the batter), and knead the dough until smooth. Finally, add the butter and knead one more time. (The dough's consistency may vary depending on its quality. It should be medium-firm.) Let the dough rise. After it has risen, roll it out to a 30x30 cm square (I measured it for youğŸ¥°ğŸ˜€). Spread the garlic sauce over the dough, sprinkle the grated cheddar cheese on top, and cut the dough into 16 equal pieces. Stack them and place them in a baking dish, leaving it to rise for about 30 minutes. After the rising time, lightly sprinkle water over the dough, add cheese between the layers, and bake in a preheated, fan-assisted oven at 180Â°C on the lowest rack until completely golden. It's ready when done. ğŸ™‚
Honestly, this is the best yeasted bread Iâ€™ve had recently. The garlic gave it such a great aroma, and the dominant smell was never overwhelming. I highly recommend trying it. ğŸ˜‹
